title: Mutually Exclusive Events
text: The events “drawing an ace” and “drawing a king” are mutually exclusive because they cannot occur at the same time.
speech: The events “drawing an ace” and “drawing a king” are mutually exclusive because they cannot occur at the same time.
pacedSpeech: The events “drawing an ace” and “drawing a king” are mutually exclusive because they cannot occur at the same time.

title: Drawing an Ace
text: The probability of drawing an ace is $$\frac{1}{13}$$
speech: The probability of drawing an ace is  1 over 13,
pacedSpeech: The probability of drawing an ace is   1 over 13,

title: Drawing a King
text: the probability of drawing a spade is also $$\frac{1}{13}$$
speech: the probability of drawing a spade is also  1 over 13
pacedSpeech: the probability of drawing a spade is also   1 over 13

title: Addition
text: Add the probability of drawing an ace with the probability of drawing a king.
speech: Add the probability of drawing an ace with the probability of drawing a king.
pacedSpeech: Add the probability of drawing an ace with the probability of drawing a king.
